title: Seasons 19 Crop Rotation Planner How To

tasks.task: Use the Crop Rotation Planner for Farming Simulator 19
subtasks: Pick a field to plan (e.g., Field 1)
Check the field's historical crop rotation (two prior years)
Key in the historical crops for the field (oldest crop at the top)
Add the current visible stubble crop (e.g., Wheat) for the first year
Plan crops for the next four years, optimizing percentage values (1.00 neutral, 1.2 better)
Repeat for subsequent fields (e.g., Field 2, 3, etc.)
Move planner entries up one line after each year's rotation (e.g., move year 2 to year 1 position)
Update the last open slot with the next crop idea (e.g., for year 5)
Adjust the planner as needed for future years' rotations

tasks.task: Use the Crop Rotation Planner for Farming Simulator 19
subtasks: Open the Crop Rotation Planner interface
Select Field 1
Find and input the previous two years' crops for Field 1
Choose the best crops for the upcoming years, considering percentage scores
Repeat for Field 2, Field 3, etc.
After each year, move the planner entries up one line
Continuously update the planner as needed over multiple years

tasks.task: Determine historical crops for a field
subtasks: Go to the selected field in the game
View the field's crop history (maybe in the journal or files)
Remember the two previous crops (2 years prior)
Note the current year's crop stubble (if visible)

tasks.task: Enter historical and future crop data into the Crop Rotation Planner
subtasks: Open the planner interface (maybe via F2 or a menu button)
Find the field in the planner grid (e.g., Field 1)
Enter the old crop (e.g., Fallow) in the first year on the left
Input the current crop (e.g., Wheat) in the next cell
For future years, select crops with high percentage scores (1.2 or higher)
Save or confirm the planner entries

tasks.task: Use the manual spreadsheet method to plan crop rotations
subtasks: Open a spreadsheet on the Mac
Create a grid with fields (e.g., Field 1, 2, 3) down the columns
For each field, note the previous two years' crops
Enter the historical data into the spreadsheet
Research and input future crop choices with best percentages
Update the spreadsheet annually for each year's rotation

tasks.task: Use the Crop Rotation Planner for Farming Simulator 19
subtasks: Determine historical crops for a field (checking in-game)
Enter historical data into the planner
Plan future crop rotations with optimal percentages
Adjust the planner entries annually as new rotations begin

tasks.task: Guide someone on using the Crop Rotation Planner in Farming Simulator 19
subtasks: Explain the importance of historical crop data
Demonstrate how to input historical crops into the planner
Show how to plan future rotations by selecting crops with highest percentages
Discuss how to move entries up each year and adjust the plan

tasks.task: Adjust the Crop Rotation Planner entries for each new year
subtasks: In the game, locate the Crop Rotation Planner interface
Scroll up the planner entries to remove the oldest field's data
Add a new entry for the next year's rotations
Save the updated planner

tasks.task: Maintain the Crop Rotation Planner for multiple years
Use a manual spreadsheet as a substitute for the in-game Crop Rotation Planner
subtasks: On a Mac, open a spreadsheet application (e.g., Numbers or Excel)
Create a table with columns for each field (Field 1, Field 2, etc.)
For each field, enter two prior years of crop rotation (step 1-2 in the video)
For each future year (up to 4), input different crops and their estimated efficiency percentages (step 3-4)
After simulating a year (i.e., moving to the next season), update the spreadsheet by moving entries up and repeating steps 1-4
Continue this process for each year, adjusting the plan as necessary

tasks.task: Use the Crop Rotation Planner for Farming Simulator 19
subtasks: For each field, note historical crop rotation (two prior years)
Enter this historical data into the planner
Choose future crops with the highest efficiency percentages
Repeat for each subsequent year’s rotations
Move planner entries up one line to reflect the passing year

tasks.task: Plan and maintain crop rotations using a manual spreadsheet for Farming Simulator 19
subtasks: For each field, enter historical crop rotation data (oldest two years)
For the current year, plan crops with highest efficiency percentages
Repeat for subsequent years, moving entries up annually
After each year's simulation, update the spreadhseet with new rotations

tasks.task: Create and maintain a manual crop rotation plan using a spreadsheet
Use a spreadsheet to plan and manage crop rotations
subtasks: Open and set up a new Excel workbook
Create columns for fields (e.g., Field1, Field2)
For each field, input the two previous year's crops (historical data)
For each field, enter planned crops for the next 4 years, optimizing percentages
After each year of the simulation, move the planner entries up by one row
Repeat the process for each subsequent year to maintain the rotation plan

tasks.task: Use a spreadsheet to create and manage a crop rotation plan for Farming Simulator 19
subtasks: Launch a spreadsheet application on a Mac
Create columns for different fields (e.g., Field1, Field2, etc.)
For each field, enter the two previous years' crops (elm column)
For each field, enter the current crop observations (e.g., stubble) in the next column
For each field, plan crops for the next 4 years, ensuring high efficiency scores
After each year, move all entries up one row and update the new current year's plan

tasks.task: Utilize the manual method to simulate the Game's Crop Rotation Planner
MAINTASK: Use the Crop Rotation Planner for Farming Simulator 19
subtasks: Select a field (e.g., Field 1)
Note the historical crops for the field (two prior years)
Enter the historical data into the planner
Plan future crops for the next four years, optimizing percentage scores
After each year, move the planner entries up one line to adjust for the new current year
